did.unittitle: Nathaniel Barney letter to William Lloyd Garrison
did.abstract: One letter, dated November 24, 1867, from Nathaniel Barney to fellow abolitionist William Lloyd Garrison (1805-1879) regarding a visit to Barney's home in Yonkers, N.Y. The letter also references Barney's regret that he will be unable to see Garrison speak in Brooklyn, N.Y.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Nathaniel Barney letter to William Lloyd Garrison, 1977.382, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Nathaniel Barney (1792-1869), a Quaker and abolitionist, was an oil and candle manufacturer who resided in Nantucket, MA. He later resided in Yonkers, N.Y.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One letter, dated November 24, 1867, from Nathaniel Barney to fellow abolitionist William Lloyd Garrison (1805-1879) regarding a visit to Barney's home in Yonkers, N.Y. The letter also references Barney's regret that he will be unable to see Garrison speak in Brooklyn, N.Y.
